kwargs.keywords: A sequence of strings representing the keywords that are expected in the response.

kwargs.keyword: A string representing a keyword that is expected in the response.
kwargs.frequency: An integer specifying the number of times `keyword` is expected to appear in the response.
kwargs.relation: A string in (`less than`, `at least`), defining the relational operator for comparison. Two relational comparisons are supported for now: if 'less than', the actual number of occurrences < frequency; if 'at least', the actual number of occurrences >= frequency.

kwargs.forbidden_words: A sequences of strings respresenting words that are not allowed in the response.

kwargs.letter: A string representing a letter that is expected in the response.
kwargs.let_frequency: An integer specifying the number of times `keyword` is expected to appear in the response.
kwargs.let_relation: A string in (`less than`, `at least`), defining the relational operator for comparison. Two relational comparisons are supported for now; if 'less than', the actual number of occurrences < frequency; if 'at least', the actual number of occurrences >= frequency.

kwargs.language: A string representing the expected language of the response. The language has to comply to the 97 types defined in `langid.py` (https://pypi.org/project/langid/1.1.5/), which follows ISO 639-1 codes (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes); for example, `en` for English, `zh` for Chinese, `fr` for French.

kwargs.num_sentences: An integer specifying the number of sentences as a threshold.
kwargs.relation: A string in (`less than`, `at least`), defining the relational operator for comparison. Two relational comparisons are supported for now: if 'less than', the actual number of sentences < the threshold; if 'at least', the actual number of sentences >= the threshold.

kwargs.num_paragraphs: An integer specifying the number of paragraphs.

kwargs.num_words: An integer specifying the number of words contained in the response.
kwargs.relation: A string in (`less than`, `at least`), defining the relational operator for comparison. Two relational comparisons are supported for now: if 'less than', the actual number of words < num_words; if 'at least', the actual number of words >= num_words.

kwargs.num_paragraphs: An integer indicating the number of paragraphs expected in the response. A paragraph is a subset of the string that is expected to be separated by '\n\n'.
kwargs.nth_paragraph: An integer indicating the paragraph number that we look at. Note that n starts from 1.
kwargs.first_word: A string that represent the first word of the bth paragraph.

kwargs.num_placeholders: An integer denoting the minimum number of placeholders required in the response.

kwargs.postscript_marker: A string containing the keyword that marks the start of the postscript section.

kwargs.num_bullets: An integer specifying the exact number of bullet lists that is required to appear in the response.

kwargs.num_highlights: An integer specifying the minimum number of highlighted sections.

kwargs.section_spliter: A string represents the section spliter keyword that marks a new section, i.e., `Section` or `SECTION`.
kwargs.num_sections: An integer specifying the number of sections.

kwargs.prompt_to_repeat: The prompt that is meant to be repeated.

kwargs.end_phrase: A string representing the phrase the response should end with.

kwargs.capital_frequency: An integer that represents the number of words that should be in all capital letters.
kwargs.capital_relation: A string that is 'at least' or 'at most' that refers to the frequency.
